answers.answer: Hello.Your line of thinking about the association of type 1 Diabetes and the white matter lesions is not at all wrong. This has a strong evidence base.Since the doctor is not convinced about this, let him assess you for MS. That way, it could be a double check.Regards

question: I am a 58 year old white female who has had diabetes for 41 years.  One and a half years ago I experienced a questionable episoide of vertigo.  After multipule MRI's complete Neurolgical work ups no one has an answer.  Dr. looking for M.S. not the right pattern of brain lesions. I have multipule white brain lesions, over thirty.  I keep thinking it might be related to diabetes but doctors keep looking from the M.S. direction,.  They say I don't have Lupus.  I have slight balancing problems, slight speech problems,slight memory problems, and the weirdest sensation in my brain.  I get these, I don't know how to explain it other than an, explosion type of feeling.  It does not hurt, just weird, almost making me dissy.  I can have severl in a day.  Does any of this sound familar to any one?  Don't know where to turnThanksJcsimon
title: Multiple White brain lesions
